clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Bone Marrow Stem Cell Therapy for Autism
clinical_study.official_title: Autologous Bone Marrow Stem Cell Therapy for Autism: An Open Label Uncontrolled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of autologous bone marrow mononuclear stem cells in the management of autism.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study was to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of autologous bone marrow mononuclear stem cells in the management of autism of 24 patients at Vinmec International Hospital, Hanoi, Vietnam

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Total Score of Childhood Autism Rating Scale (CARS)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Examples of adverse events to look for: vomiting, increased hyperactivity, fever, bleeding, hematoma, seizures and neurological deficits

arm_group.description: 2 intrathecal administrations of autologous bone marrow mononuclear cells at baseline and 3 months afterward

intervention.description: Transplantation of Autologous Bone Marrow Mononuclear Cells

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis of autism according to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual-IV (DSM-IV) diagnostic criteria for autistic disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- Epilepsy
- Hydrocephalus with ventricular drain
- Coagulation disorders
- Allergy to anesthetic agents
- Severe health conditions such as cancer, failure of heart, lung, liver or kidney
- Active infections
- Severe psychiatric disorders
